usecase.commu.chat

Class Chat

  • java.lang.Object
    • usecase.commu.chat.Chat
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, MessageObservable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Announcement, DirectChat

    public abstract class Chat
extends java.lang.Object
implements MessageObservable, java.io.Serializable
    The Base class for Chat. Any chat should supports Manage and Messaging.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • notify

                   Message newMessage)
        Description copied from interface: MessageObservable
        Update all other chat with the updater.
        Specified by:
        notify in interface MessageObservable
        Parameters:
        person - the person's chat record to notify.
        newMessage - the new messages.

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage(java.util.UUID sender,
                        java.lang.Object content)
        Send a message. If the sender don't have AccessLevel.EDIT, throws AccessException.

        Before using this method, check the sender's access, and the chat's active status.

        Parameters:
        content - the content
        Throws:
        MessageTimeFlowError - if the time of the new message is prior to the previous message.
        AccessException - if the person don't have AccessLevel.EDIT.

      • setAccess

        public void setAccess(java.util.UUID caster,
                      java.util.UUID person,
                      AccessLevel level)
        Set the access level for the person, only when the caster has AccessLevel.MANAGE. If the person doesn't have a record yet, do nothing.
        Parameters:
        caster - the caster of this operation.
        person - the person that is effected.
        level - the level of access that it has been given.
        Throws:
        AccessException - if the caster don't has AccessLevel.MANAGE.
        See Also:
        AccessManage.setAccess(UUID, AccessLevel)

      • hasAccess

        public boolean hasAccess(java.util.UUID person,
                         AccessLevel level)
        Check the person has at least the access level specified.
        Parameters:
        person - the person.
        level - the level required.
        Returns:
        true if people has at least the level of access.
        See Also:
        AccessManage.hasAccess(UUID, AccessLevel)

      • getAllParticipant

        public java.util.List<java.util.UUID> getAllParticipant()
        Return all people that has some access (not AccessLevel.UNDEFINED).
        Returns:
        a list of people that has some access.
